alert.note: Alert for Southern Queens (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 4:12PM EDT until July 05 at 1:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 1 AM EDT WEDNESDAY... ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM WEDNESDAY TO 2 AM EDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Up to one foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Southern Queens County. * WHEN...For the first Coastal Flood Advisory, from 8 PM this evening to 1 AM EDT Wednesday. For the second Coastal Flood Advisory, from 9 PM Wednesday to 2 AM EDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is expected in the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline. Expect around 1 foot of inundation above ground level in low lying, vulnerable areas. Some roads and low lying property including parking lots, parks, lawns and homes/businesses with basements near the waterfront will experience shallow flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...An additional round of minor flooding is possible with the evening high tide cycle Thursday.
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property.
